greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let k be a Sierpiński or Riesel number, and let p be the largest number in a set of n primes which cover every number of the form k*2^m + 1 (or of the form k*2^m - 1) with m >= 1. a(n) = 0 if no covering set with n primes exists, otherwise a(n) = p if and only if there exists no number k that has a covering set with precisely n primes and with largest prime < p.
results.author: _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Jun 23 2018
